questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You set up a new instance of Dynamics 365 for Customer Service.
Users report a variety of issues working with cases on mobile devices.
You need to configure the mobile app to be able to view cases.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Answers are incorrect. If able to login but not see cases, Case entity needs enable for mobile checked. If user unable to login to mobile, they need security role which includes Dynamics 365 for mobile privilege - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-engagement/mobile-app/set-up-dynamics-365-for-phones-and-dynamics-365-for-tablets

comments.content: You are right, those are not the options marked as correct though.

discussion.content:
Agreed to D365V:
1. User is able to login but can't see Case Records --> "Configure Mobile Settings on Case Entity Level"
2. Second is correct.
3. User reports that they cannot access the system from Dynamics 365 mobile app --> Configure a security role in the mobile permission set of the appropriate user
not able to verify if answers are CBA or ABC?
Hi Everyone, can anyone confirm the right answer whether it is a,b,c or c,b,a. I have to take the exam. After reading this discussion I am confused.Please help

comments.content: Its a,b,c

discussion.content:
Answers are wrong to me. 
 [Users report that they canno access the system from the dynamics 365 mobile app] it has nothing to do with [Configure mobile setting set at the case entity level].
It should be:
1 > 1
2 > 2
3 > 3
in exam
in exam

Answers are correct 
Bcz user can see case entity but cant access records—so security role
Form
User cant see system means its configuration setting issue on mobile
In exam
on the exam

The answer is correct.
1. Means users can access case entity but records : Security role limitations
2. Correct, there is no doubt 
3. It mentions cannot see system from Mobile App, means users' role can access mobile App, but not able to see the system (inclined means Case entity), so the Case entity is not enabled for Mobile App. So it is Configure Mobile Setting on Case entity Level.
FYI - I saw this question in the exam.
Answers are incorrect.. I agree the D365V’s answers

Hi guys, let´s dig down in the question:
1 - The question refers that you as a Customer Service Developer, you need to assure that everyone has the chart.
2 - What do you need to ask the Sales person to do? SO the answers are in the context of the Sales Person.

Now the answers:
1 - Share the chart with the team - CORRECT as by sharing the chart with a team, all the team members will have access to the chart
2 - Assign the chart to each person on the team - INCORRECT as you can only share with one user or with a all team. In the answer they explicitly refer to each person on the team
3 - Export the user chart to Microsoft Power BI. Import it as a Power BI visualization - INCORRECT - you can only export as a XML (no option to export for Power BI)
4 - Export the user chart for import as a user chart - CORRECT - as a sales person, I can export the chart as XML. Later on, another user can import the XML and the chart will be showed as a Personal Chart
5 - Export the user chart for import as system chart - INCORRECT - only a System Admin can import System Chart

comments.content: I total agree with this
but in the scenario you are a developer .. and for that reason you are a system admin. However ... these questions are crazy!
Only after reading the question again I saw it ... it is asking <<Which actions should the salesperson perform? >> ... so fgrosso you a totally right!

discussion.content: The second option should be Export the user chart for import as a system chart. A chart cannot be shared to more than a user or team.

comments.content: Agree with it
Of course a personal chart can be shared to more than a user or team. Try in the system! Maybe what you wanted to write is <<A chart cannot be ASSIGNED to more than a user or team>>
But then is says Which actions should the salesperson perform...

It says you are Dynamics 365 for Customer Service developer
YOU need to ensure....
Nope that can't be the answer. The question asks what should the SALESPERSON do.. Only System Admin can import as a system chart.

discussion.content: wrong! The answer is first export as userchart, second share with team

What about --> you export and import the chart as a system chart and then share the chart with the team?
I think this makes sense the most here, right?
www.thirstyexplorer.net

I think that share the chart with the team in this case does not mean using the share button. You simply: 
1. Export the chart for import as user chart
2. Share (i.e. via E-mail of Sharepoint) the exported chart with the team members so they can import it

The answer is wrong. 
As the chart is created by the salesperson and not by system admin/system customizer so this chart is a personal chart. lets see the options here :-

1)Share the chart with the team - correct

2)Assign the chart to each person on the team -Incorrect . Not possible because at a time a personal chart can be assigned to one person or one team. one chart can never be assigned to multiple users .

3)Export the user chart to Ms Power BI - Incorrect - Not possible

4)Export the user chart for import as a user chart - Correct - Possible but not required as the personal chart can directly be shared without export/import

5)Export the user chart for import as a system chart - Incorrect - A system chart is available to all users with appropriate security roles

So options 1 and 4 are correct

The question doesn't make sense! <<ensure that the chart is available to all users on the team>> Does it mean there are other teams that shouldn't see the chart? In that case it shouldn't be created as system chart. But let's assume that this is not required and let's exclude the wrong answer and see what's left over. "Assign the chart to each person on the team" means if there are 10 persons in a team I have to assign 10 times? this is not possible! there is only 1 owner. It could be assigned to the team but then the option should be "assign to the team" and not "to each person on the team" ... let's say this answer is wrong. If we exclude this answer than the only possible right one are <<Share the chart with the team>> and <<Export the user chart for import as a system chart>> ... I hope I don't get this question
Was in my exam, I simply went for Share with the team and Assign to each member.

step1. Export the chart and import as a user chart
step2. Share the chart with Team

second - export ..system chart

in exam

Answer is correct as question says that you need to share personal chart with each team member.
So in order to do that firstly, we need to share chart
Secondly owner of chart have option to share with some specific or all of team mates so this is major step which shows that everyone in team will be mapped properly with authority of access such as read, write etc...

This link as answered the questions, thanks to Carl!
https://carldesouza.com/sharing-personal-charts-dynamics-365/

Option 1: Share the chart with the team
Option 2: Export the user chart for import as a user chart
This way, you give the file to another user, where he will import it, and it will appear under his "My Chart" list.

The only action that makes sense to me is"Share the chart with the team".
Obviously, that meets the requirement without any other step. 
So export the chart would be another scenario in providing the xml file to the users of the team in order they can import it but it does not ensures that every user will import it.
According, to the phrase in the question telling that "each action maybe used once, more than once, or not at all". I would say the same thing in step 1 and 2 because it the only thing that matches even if we know that once is enough.
Assign the chart to the team would have been another simple possibility but it not listed.

The question is not worded well.. however, you must pay close attention to the trick in the question. Although, you are defined as a developer, the question asks "Which action should a salesperson perform?". A salesperson wouldn't have the ability to export the user chart for import as a system chart" unless that user specifically had the role of system administrator or system customizer. Therefore this option is eliminated.

comments.content: 100% right!

discussion.content:
This should be:
1. Export the chart and import as User Chart
2. Share the chart with the team.

Note: Assign can be only to a team or a person and once its assigned to another person then the ownerships remain with the other person. so I think Assign option is not corrct.
Look at this article, I hope it serves to clarify doubts -> https://carldesouza.com/sharing-personal-charts-dynamics-365/

The correct answer is "share the chart with the team" and that's it. It's not possible to assign the chart to more than one owner. Wonder the author of this exam has actually ever worked with dynamics crm at all?
I'd say also is a,b. D has more sense but a salespersons couldn't do it. I think they wanted to write "assign the chart to the team" and "share the chart with each person on the team".

First: Export the user Chart for import as a user Chart, then
second: Share the Chart with the Team.

The question is - Which action should the "Salesperson" perform ?.. the sales person in order to make sure the chart is visible to all team either he/she can
(1) Share the chart with the team
(2) Export the user chart for import as a system chart. (here he doesn't have to import the chart. The mentioned Dynamics 365 for Customer Service developer which is you will be doing it)
IMO, this is simply a typo error by question maker.. Assign to each one, means, share with each one of the the team.. Because, I have tried this myself. It works. I feel this is just another typo..
Answers are correct as chart has to share only specific people of a team or individuals, to import it system chart would be public for all.

comments.content: I think the same thing, that option applies to both
It doesn't make sense to have to Share twice. The question says to share with a single Team.

discussion.content: This was in the exam
This is one of those questions that aren't perfectly asked but you get the idea based on the options that are given to you for the answers. In the light of that, I think the answers are correct.

comments.content: Cant be. The chart owner can only be 1 User or Team at a time.. You can't assign it to each of the users.

discussion.content: I think the correct 2nd option is Export the Chart for Import as a User Chart. By adding it to a Solution, it's making a backup of the chart. As has been said, the Assign and System Chart options don't make sense.
I think the solution is correct. The goal is to share the chart with everyone in the team not with everyone in the organization.
Then Everyone* within the organization

The answer is Correct. You need to ensure that Users with a team can see the chart. You can do this by Sharing the chart with the team or assigning to each user in a team. If you export and import as a system chart, then environment within the organization can have access to it which defeats the goal i.e Share with a specific team

comments.content: Yeah the more I think about it (and after quickly spinning up a user chart in my dev environment to play), I'm 99% sure it's Share the Chart with the Team, and Export user chart for import as user chart. This makes the most sense in retrospect.

There is a statement in question "You need to ensure that the chart is available to all users on the team.". With that said they do NOT want to share with all users in organization. So export and import as system chart would not be appropriate.

Though, it doesn't specify ONLY with the team members. Importing the chart as a system chart would actually accomplish the goal of sharing it with everyone on the team (along with everyone in the instance with access to the entity in question--but it never says only with the team).

This one is tough. If the second option provided on the left was to assign the chart to the team, I think it would be share the chart and assign the chart. As it's written--as others have pointed out--the assignment makes no sense as you can't assign to more than one individual other than by using a team. Do they mean assign it to the team? I'm not sure. I think share and import as system chart are the most likely answers.
but also <<assign to each person on the team is not correct>> because that is not possible. Couldn't they just write <<assign to the team>>? I honestly want to know who is writing those questions!
When you said "assigning to each user in a team" technically is wrong.

discussion.content: so what is the correct answer? I also thought the second option should be import as a system chart.

When you share with the team, you are already done.
Export and import as a system chart, is just another way to share chart.
https://carldesouza.com/sharing-personal-charts-dynamics-365/

The question is also not "which action and in which order" but talk about associations that can be used once, more than once or never. Some part is missing.
This answer doesn't make sense. A chart can only be assigned to one user or team.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service developer.
A salesperson creates a chart.
You need to ensure that the chart is available to all users on the team.
Which actions should the salesperson perform? To answer, drag the appropriate actions to the correct users. Each action may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: IN exam and the answer is correct I believe.
in exam
Something similar was in my exam, the app designer is the answer
For creating views we need to do changes by selecting any entity type with help of power app design.. so yes answer is design app
The answer is correct because using Advanced find is a personal view

comments.content: And i think that's the whole idea behind - make the question wordy so it throws you off - even if the answer is straightforward :-)

My thoughts exactly. But a view created using Advanced find is a personal view, and has to be shared explicitly with Users and Teams - by default, it is not available to the entire org. So App Designer is the obvious choice.

discussion.content: What threw me off was the part about not allowing the user of custom code. My first through as advanced find, as you can create a view with advanced find.
in exam

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service system administrator.
Your organization does not permit the use of custom code for solutions.
You need to create a view that can be viewed by all users in an organization.
Where should you create the view?

HOTSPOT -
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service developer.
You need to create a report that shows annual customer growth from 2012-2018. The report must be printable and must include company branding.
Which reporting options should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

comments.content:
There is an option: 'Revert to Personal Option', when You click Actions button at the top bar.
It changes Viewable By from Organization to Individual (owner).
Anyway, I agree that Fetch based reporting services may be correct
Practically speaking, report wizard and fetch based report are both the same thing. I am impressed how they play with words in the exam :D

This is the correct answer :)
Moderator should change the actual answer on the screen to this, that is the correct one.

discussion.content:
Answer should be:
1. Report Wizard
2. Fetch based reporting services 
No such thing as a personal report. Reports are either 'individual' or 'organization'.
You can only add personal or organization branding using the fetch based reporting services. So for 2 I believe it should be Fetch Based Reporting Services

Could everyone double check this?

Had an official MS trainer in for this exam... the answers came up as report wizard, and personal.

Was in my exam, I selected Wizard and Fetch. Not because I knew but because I saw this question here and read the comments below. It was so helpful guys, 70% of my exam had questions from here. Good luck!

second - fetch

in exam
Fetch-based reports are built in Visual Studio, so you can add custom graphics.

Based on the link: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/customize-organize-reports

Fetch-based Reporting Services reports. These reports use FetchXML queries that are proprietary to Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (on-premises) instead of filtered views to retrieve data for reports. Reports that you create by using the Report Wizard in Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (on-premises) are Fetch-based reports.

1st it's ok.
It's impossible to add branding style into a chart or a personal view, so I think 2nd it's Fetch-based Reporting Services.
In exam
I am also confused, what is the correct answer for 2nd option?
Exactly https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-engagement/customize/customize-organize-reports

choices.B: Update the publisher prefix to new.

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Customer Service system administrator. You export a solution containing customization from the development environment and import the solution into a quality assurance environment.
You need to allow removal of the customization and solution from the quality assurance environment.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Wrong
The right answer is A

comments.content: if you want to allow removal of customization (not part of it, but whole) then answer A is correct - not D

discussion.content: I believe that the problem with this question is that it's not well formulated. In order to have the option 'Maintain customizations', the solution must be of managed type, but if you want to "allow removal of the customization" in the future, an unmanaged solution must be used.
The correct answer is A. The question clearly says remove customization and solution, the "and" is the key here. When a managed solution is uninstalled the customization is automatically removed

A managed solution can be uninstalled after it is imported. All the components of that solution are deleted by uninstalling the solution. When you import an unmanaged solution, you add all the solution components into your default solution. You can't delete the components by uninstalling the solution.
So A should be right.
www.thirstyexplorer.net

I believe D is correct. When a solution is unmanaged, you can perform the following actions:
Add components, Remove components, Delete components that allow for deletion, Export and import the unmanaged solution.

Export the solution as a managed solution.
A Correct

Not well formulated. When removing a managed solution, the entities and configuration are also removed. There is no mention of that in the question. So, base on just wanting to remove the solution, unmanaged should be correct. As you can remove an unmanaged solution and keeps the entities. Also, as unmanaged, you can change the customization (or delete them manually). Those exams shouldn't be an English exam, but instead a verification of your ability to configure.

If we check on the link below :
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/marketing/transfer-solution

The recommendation is to use a managed solution , however, I am not sure if it gonna make any difference as it is for marketing.

Honestly, I can understand both A and D being correct depending on how you interpret the question.. Why can't they ask straight forward questions? Honestly if a client or colleague said this to me in real life I would ask them to clarify.

Answer is A: If you mean removal of the customizations AFTER REMOVAL OF THE SOLUTION in QA.
Answer is D: if you mean removal of the customizations DURING IMPORT.
This is to clearify the discussion here where some are saying A and some D. I was going for D first but after I understand why people go for A, I think A is the correct answer
The correct answer seems like A
Correct answer is managed solution

A
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/export-solution

the aim of the solution is to replace everything in the QA environment since a new version or development of the same has been done and the QA team has to work on the fresh solution. so the correct answer is D. this will mean not old customizations and solution will be QA-ed with the new solution
A should be answer

In the QA environment is it required to make some changes to the components of the imported solution to achieve a variety of quality tests ? or that's enough to test the whole solution exported form the dev team with no need to alter the solution ? that's because it make sense and make a big difference if we must exported as managed or unmanaged (except for unmanaged there is complexity for removing customizations applicable to the default solution and the QA team must do it manually) .
D - "Allow the removal of...". Not perform the removal.
The correct answer is A without doubt

comments.content: Question Says "allow removal of the customization and solution" so my recommended answer is A

discussion.content: Think of the scenario guys, it said export a solution containing customization from the development environment and import the solution into a quality assurance environment，if you wanna delete customization in the quality assurance environment, you gatta export it as an unmanaged solution, so I'll go for D-Export the solution as unmanaged

I believe the correct answer is A.
Unmanaged solutions allow you to remove them, but in order to remove the customizations you have to do it one by one, but by doing that you don´t remove the last customization applied, you remove the whole component.

The right answer is A.
A managed solution can be uninstalled after it is imported. All the components of that solution are deleted by uninstalling the solution. When you import an unmanaged solution, you add all the components of that solution into your default solution. You can't delete the components by uninstalling the solution.

In exam question:
Yes agreed, not well formulated question. Based on the info given, A should be the correct answer.
I understand the "allow removal of the customization" as all customization, so A is the correct answer
